chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. All costs are to be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts Office in the amount of $50 a month beginning November 21, 2022. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
The defendant shall attend AODA and follow through with any recommended treatments at the discretion of the probation agent.

Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant must write a letter of apology to Officer Amundson that is due within 30 days and is to be preapproved by the probation agent. Defendant is to attend counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent. Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: The defendant is to successfully complete the period of probation that was ordered in count 1. The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall comply with all of the terms of bond, which continues to remain in effect during the period of this agreement.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement the court granted the state's motion for a deferred entry of judgment of conviction on this charge for a period of 1 year.  Upon successful completion of the agreement the state will move to dismiss count 2.

ADDRESS INFO for Jake M. Wendt
Current: 102 N Park Ave Apt B, Medford, WI 54451 United States  (Effective: 11-01-2022)
Prior: 2670 University Avenue, Marshall House, Green Bay, WI 54311 United States
In Court Notice to DE After Sentencing
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement

2:50 PM Defendant Jake M. Wendt in court.  Attorney Jon Padgham in court for Jake M. Wendt.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Attorney Tlusty recites agreement for the record. Attorney Padgham informed the court that DE is waiving the preliminary hearing.  Court found waiver given freely and voluntarily.  Court binds DE over for trial. Information filed with the court.  DE waived any further reading of the information. Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 1 and 2. Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court accepts the plea  and makes a finding of guilt. Statement made by Attorney Tlusty. Statement made by Attorney Padgham. Statement made by Defendant. Court orders a withheld sentence on count 1 and places defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions: Defendant is to pay court costs, submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, write a letter of apology to Officer Amundson due within 30 days and to be preapproved by the probation agent. Defendant is to undergo AODA and follow through with any treatment recommendations at the discretion of the probation agent, Defendant is to go to counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent. Court accepts and orders the deferred judgment agreement for count 2 and holds it open for 1 year with the standard conditions as well as successfully completing the probationary period ordered in count 1. Court costs are to be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts office in the amount of $50 a month beginning November 21, 2022.-JN
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:34 PM Defendant Jake M. Wendt in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify for a public defender and he does not want an attorney for this case.  Defendant is waiving the reading of the criminal complaint and charges.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court makes a probable cause finding based on the criminal complaint so that the court may order a competency evaluation.   Court orders a competency evaluation.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.  If there is a treatment option, defendant shall write a letter to the district attorney. - rt
